title: A Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacodynamics of MK-8931/SCH 900931 in Patients With Alzheimer's Disease [Phase 1b; Protocol No. 010-00 (Also Known as P07820)]
description_brief: This study will assess the safety and pharmacodynamics of three different doses of MK-8931, a ß-secretase inhibitor, in participants with mild to moderate Alzheimer's Disease (AD).
explanation_target: Reason: The trial tests MK-8931, described as a ß‑secretase (BACE1) inhibitor. BACE1 inhibitors are small‑molecule drugs designed to reduce production of amyloid‑β peptides (disease pathology) by inhibiting the β‑secretase cleavage of APP, i.e., a disease‑targeting mechanism rather than a symptomatic cognitive enhancer or neuropsychiatric treatment. citeturn0search1turn0search7

Act: Extracted details — trial intervention: MK-8931 (also called verubecestat, development code SCH 900931) given orally at multiple doses in mild–moderate AD; comparator: placebo; endpoints include pharmacodynamics (CSF Aβ reductions) and safety/tolerability. Phase 1b results and company reporting show dose‑dependent reductions in CSF Aβ consistent with target engagement of BACE1. These facts identify MK-8931 as a disease‑targeted small molecule. citeturn0search3turn0search2turn0search7

Reflect: Classification check — fits the definition: small molecule (not a biologic) that targets Alzheimer’s pathology (amyloid production) rather than directly enhancing cognition or treating neuropsychiatric symptoms. No conflicting details in the description. Therefore the correct category is 'disease-targeted small molecule'.

explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational drug MK-8931 (verubecestat) is explicitly described as an oral BACE1 (β‑secretase) inhibitor, a mechanism intended to reduce production of amyloid‑β peptides by blocking β‑secretase cleavage of APP; this directly targets amyloid biology central to CADRO category A. citeturn0search0turn0search6

Act: Extracted details from the trial description — intervention: MK-8931 (verubecestat; SCH‑900931), an oral small‑molecule selective BACE1 inhibitor; endpoints include pharmacodynamics shown as CSF Aβ reductions and safety/tolerability, consistent with target engagement of BACE1 and amyloid pathway modulation. These facts map to the Amyloid beta CADRO category. citeturn0search0turn0search2

Reflect: Confirmed classification — the drug is a disease‑targeted small molecule acting on amyloid production (not a symptomatic neurotransmitter agent, not an anti‑inflammatory, and not a diagnostic); therefore the most specific CADRO match is A) Amyloid beta. Subsequent development and clinical program (EPOCH/APECS) and PK/PD and Phase 1b CSF Aβ lowering support this interpretation. citeturn0search3turn0search5
